body_html:
I am having a similar issue but while trying to add dropout after my convolutional layers. The dropout documentation describes that noise_shape can have a shape like noise_shape = [k, 1, 1, n], but when this gets passed to random_uniform() in the dropout code I get the following error: "ValueError: Shape must be rank 1 but is rank 4 for 'conv_dropout/random_uniform/RandomUniform' (op: 'RandomUniform') with input shapes: [10,1,1,36]."

Here is the relevant part of the code:

        noise_shape = tf.placeholder(dtype=tf.int32, shape=[batch_size, 1, 1, output.get_shape().as_list()[3]])
        output_drop = tf.nn.dropout(x=output, keep_prob=0.7, noise_shape=noise_shape, name='conv_dropout')

Should I be defining or passing noise_shape differently?

I am having a similar issue but while trying to add dropout after my convolutional layers. The dropout documentation describes that noise_shape can have a shape like noise_shape = [k, 1, 1, n], but when this gets passed to random_uniform() in the dropout code I get the following error: "ValueError: Shape must be rank 1 but is rank 4 for 'conv_dropout/random_uniform/RandomUniform' (op: 'RandomUniform') with input shapes: [10,1,1,36]."
Here is the relevant part of the code:
        noise_shape = tf.placeholder(dtype=tf.int32, shape=[batch_size, 1, 1, output.get_shape().as_list()[3]])
        output_drop = tf.nn.dropout(x=output, keep_prob=0.7, noise_shape=noise_shape, name='conv_dropout')

Should I be defining or passing noise_shape differently?
body:
I am having a similar issue but while trying to add dropout after my convolutional layers. The dropout documentation describes that noise_shape can have a shape like noise_shape = [k, 1, 1, n], but when this gets passed to random_uniform() in the dropout code I get the following error: "ValueError: Shape must be rank 1 but is rank 4 for 'conv_dropout/random_uniform/RandomUniform' (op: 'RandomUniform') with input shapes: [10,1,1,36]."

Here is the relevant part of the code:
```
        noise_shape = tf.placeholder(dtype=tf.int32, shape=[batch_size, 1, 1, output.get_shape().as_list()[3]])
        output_drop = tf.nn.dropout(x=output, keep_prob=0.7, noise_shape=noise_shape, name='conv_dropout')
```
Should I be defining or passing noise_shape differently?
